description: Dr. Lloyd Williams, an ophthalmologist with Duke University, has traveled with the Himalayan Cataract Project for the past decade on a mission to cure blindness. He talks about his recent travels to South Sudan, a country with the highest rate of blindness in the world.
title: This eye surgeon is on a mission to cure blindness in South Sudan

description: Ukraine's defense ministry and intelligence service published video that they said showed a maritime drone attack on a Russian warship off the Crimean coast. NBC News was unable to independently verify the date or location of the images.
title: Video said to show Ukrainian attack on Russian warship off Crimea

description: Convoys with hundreds of angry farmers driving heavy-duty tractors created chaos outside the European Union’s headquarters on Thursday, demanding leaders at an E.U. summit provide relief from rising prices and bureaucracy.
title: Horns blaring and engines roaring, angry farmers take their protest to key E.U. summit

description: Thousands of livestock are stranded off the coast of Australia after their ship was turned back by Red Sea turmoil, raising concerns among animal rights groups.
title: Thousands of sheep and cattle are stuck on a ship after Red Sea attacks forced a turnaround

description: Seven-time Formula One champion Lewis Hamilton has been linked with a shock move from Mercedes to Ferrari next year, according to reports on Thursday.
title: F1 great Lewis Hamilton set for shock move from Mercedes to Ferrari in 2025, reports say

description: Indian police cleared a suspected Chinese spy pigeon after eight months’ detention and released it into the wild Tuesday, news agency Press Trust of India reported.
title: Indian police clear a suspected Chinese spy pigeon after 8 months in bird lockup

description: European farmers took their anger to the streets of Brussels before a E.U. summit, warning leaders not to ignore their concerns for better prices and less bureaucracy.
title: European farmers surround European Parliament building to demand reforms

description: A 3-year-old boy got stuck inside a ‘Hello Kitty’ toy claw machine by climbing through the prize dispenser in a shopping mall in Australia. Local police had to smash the glass to rescue him.
title: Watch: Australian boy is rescued after getting stuck inside a claw machine

description: An Israeli-owned ship, MV Bahijah, with more than 12,000 sheep and 2,000 cows on board, is languishing in Australia after its journey was disrupted following attacks in the Red Sea by Yemen's Houthi militia.
title: Thousands of sheep and cattle stranded after ship's Red Sea route canceled by security concerns

description: Thailand’s Constitutional Court ruled Wednesday that the progressive Move Forward party must cease advocating amending the law on royal defamation.
title: Thai court rules election winners must stop trying to change royal insults law

description: Former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan was found guilty of corruption and sentenced to 14 years, his second conviction in as many days ahead of elections.
title: Former Pakistan leader Imran Khan is jailed for 14 years a day after 10-year sentence

description: The Department of State has issued new travel advisories for both Jamaica and the Bahamas, urging Americans to “reconsider travel” due to a recent rise in violent crimes, including armed robberies, sexual assault and homicides on the islands.
title: Travel warnings issued for Jamaica and Bahamas amid growing violence

description: Three days after three U.S. soldiers were killed by a drone attack in Jordan, U.S. officials say a campaign of attacks could go on for weeks, including on targets outside Iran. The U.S. blaming an umbrella group of Iran-backed militias known as the Islamic Resistance in Iraq for the drone attack. Keir Simmons reports.
title: U.S. plans 'campaign' of retaliatory strikes after killing of 3 soldiers, officials say

description: FBI Director Christopher Wray told a House committee that hackers in China are focusing on American infrastructure and preparing to "wreak havoc and cause real-world harm to American citizens and communities." He said the targets could include electrical grids, water treatment plants, gas pipelines and transportation systems. NBC's Ken Dilanian reports.
title: FBI Director Christopher Wray warns of alarming hacking threat from China

description: They are children of war, finally getting the help they desperately need -- some 50 children from Gaza with fractures, head injuries and some with cancer. We follow their journey out of Gaza, into Egypt and finally the United Arab Emirates. NBC's Hala Gorani reports.
title: Inside harrowing journey out of Gaza for wounded children
